channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: P9 billion allotted for printing of learning modules
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: The Department of Education has allotted P9 billion for the printing of learning modules to be used by students for school year 2020-2021.

item.title: Duterte to PNP: Stay resilient to fight COVID-19
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Citing their “selfless service” as frontliners in the fight against COVID-19, President Duterte asked the 205,000-strong Philippine National Police to be more resilient amid a pandemic that has affected more than 2,000 in its ranks.

item.title: Educational institutions urged to transition to flexi-learning
item.description: Amid the COVID-19 pandemic, Sen. Bong Go urged the education sector to carefully consider the use of online platforms in facilitating education in the country and ensure that any resulting burden from the transition will not be passed on to students.

item.title: 3rd tranche of cash aid up to Congress — DSWD
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: The Department of Social Welfare and Development assured the people yesterday that the distribution of a third tranche of Social Amelioration Program emergency cash aid for poor families amid the cononavirus pandemic will start once Congress passes a new law.

item.title: Hospitals required to submit data Hospitals required to submit data
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: Public and private hospitals are required to regularly submit bed occupancy and other relevant data to the Department of Health.

item.title: Manila ready to procure vaccine – Isko
item.description: Manila Mayor Isko Moreno has signed an ordinance appropriating P200 million for the immediate procurement of COVID-19 vaccines for all city residents should it become available this year.

item.title: Binay, Saguisag file 25th petition vs anti-terror law
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: Former vice president Jejomar Binay and former senator Rene Saguisag yesterday led a group of lawyers in filing the 25th petition questioning the constitutionality of the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020 before the Supreme Court.

item.title: DICT supports proposed e-governance act
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: The Department of Information and Communications Technology xpressed its full support for Senate Bill 1738 or the proposed “E-Governance Act of 2020” filed by Sen. Bong Go that seeks to institutionalize e-governance in the Philippines to cope with the transition to the new normal amid challenges posed by COVID-19.

item.title: ABS-CBN franchise denial linked to House speakership
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: Does the rejection of the ABS-CBN franchise renewal have something to do with the scheduled change of leadership in the House of Representatives later this year?

item.title: MVP assures Duterte of improved PLDT services
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: PLDT Inc. chairman, president and CEO Manuel V. Pangilinan has given assurance that the country’s largest and only integrated telecommunications company will comply with President Duterte’s call for improved services by yearend.
